marketNews.title: Global Shift To Renewables Slowed In 2023, Policy Group Says
marketNews.content: The policy group REN21 reported that the global shift to renewable energy slowed in 2023 due to regulatory gaps, political pressures, and failure to set clear targets. By the end of 2023, only 13 countries, including the US, India, and China, had implemented renewable energy policies across the building, industry, transportation, and agriculture sectors, but their contribution was only 12.7% of total energy consumed. REN21 also reported that among 69 countries with end-user renewable energy targets, only 17 extended those targets beyond 2024.

marketNews.title: New Special Economic Zones (SEZs) Prepared by Government
marketNews.content: The government is preparing 3 new Special Economic Zones (KEK), consisting of an integrated area in BSD City by Bumi Serpong Damai (BSDE), hospital development in Batam, and a smelter project in Morowali by Vale Indonesia (INCO). The total value of the integrated SEZ in BSD is estimated at 18.8 trillion rupiah with the creation of 13,446 jobs, while the Morowali smelter SEZ reaches 135.38 trillion rupiah with 136,000 direct and indirect workers. The health SEZ in Batam is estimated to be worth 6.91 trillion rupiah with job opportunities reaching 105,406.

tickerNews.title: BYD Releases New Hybrid Car, Risk for ASII
tickerNews.content: BYD announced the launch of a new plug-in hybrid vehicle (PHEV) with the latest technology (DM 5.0), claimed to have fuel consumption as efficient as 2.9 liters per 100 km or 34.5 km per liter (vs. DM 4.0: 3.8 liters per 100 km or 26.3 km per liter). The price for the DM 5.0 version will start from 99.8 thousand yuan (equivalent to ~220 million rupiah) compared to the DM 4.0 which has a starting price of 79.8 thousand yuan (equivalent to ~180 million rupiah). However, the car price has the potential to be higher if it enters Indonesia due to applicable taxes, such as import tax and luxury goods sales tax (PPnBM). To date, there is still no further information on whether the PHEV DM 5.0 (models: Qin L sedan and Seal 06 sedan) will be marketed by BYD in Indonesia, considering that the DM 4.0 version (models: Qin Plus DM-i sedan and Song Plus DM-i SUV) has also not yet entered Indonesia. However, with BYD officially entering Indonesia early this year and the purchase of their land in Subang, it is not impossible that its PHEV cars will be marketed in Indonesia in the future, starting with DM 4.0. Looking at the IIMS 2024 event, BYD products were responded to positively with vehicle purchase orders (SPK) reaching 1,000 units (vs. Toyota SPK: 762 units and Wuling SPK: 799 units). As of now, BYD has only marketed 3 battery electric vehicle (BEV) models in Indonesia, namely the Dolphin SUV, Atto 3 SUV, and Seal sedan. These products have starting prices of 425 million rupiah, 515 million rupiah, and 629 million rupiah, respectively. The hybrid car segment itself has experienced rapid growth in Indonesia, where ASII is the market leader in the hybrid segment with a market share up to 72.5% as of FY23. Key Takeaway: With a much more affordable selling price, the potential presence of hybrid cars from BYD can have a negative impact on ASII's market share. For information, hybrid cars distributed by ASII - such as the Innova Zenix Hybrid (fuel consumption 18.8 km per liter) and Yaris Cross Hybrid (fuel consumption 27 km per liter) - each have a more expensive price than BYD, starting at 430 million rupiah and 367 million rupiah, respectively. In terms of contribution, hybrid cars accounted for ~7% of ASII's total car sales volume in FY23.

tickerNews.title: MPMX: Will Distribute Dividends of IDR 115/Share, Indicating 11% Yield
tickerNews.content: MPMX: Mitra Pinasthika Mustika will distribute 2023 fiscal year dividends of 502 billion rupiah or 115 rupiah per share, equivalent to a 95.5% dividend payout ratio. This dividend amount even exceeds our expectation in the Mini Unboxing MPMX at the level of 82 rupiah per share. The dividend distribution schedule will be announced to the public on June 28, 2024. Referring to MPMX share price on Thursday (30/5) at 1,045 rupiah per share, the indicated dividend yield is 11%.

tickerNews.title: PGAS: Will Distribute Dividends for 2023 Fiscal Year
tickerNews.content: PGAS: Perusahaan Gas Negara will distribute 2023 fiscal year dividends of approximately 222.5 million US dollars or 148.3 rupiah per share, assuming an exchange rate of 16,160. The cum date and dividend payment schedule have not yet been announced. Referring to PGAS share price on Thursday (30/5) at 1,635 rupiah per share, the indicated dividend yield is 9%.

tickerNews.title: Petrosea Signs Credit Facilities from BCA
tickerNews.content: PTRO: Petrosea signed credit facilities amounting to 240 million US dollars and 1.3 trillion rupiah from Bank Central Asia (BBCA). The agreement has a tenor of 8-10 years and is intended to support business expansion and debt refinancing. In addition, PTRO also signed a working capital facility of 170 million US dollars from BBCA, designated to support operational activities in the EPC and mining business lines.

tickerNews.title: Medco Energi International Will Distribute Final Dividend for FY2023
tickerNews.content: MEDC: Medco Energi Internasional will distribute a final dividend for the 2023 fiscal year of approximately 45 million US dollars or ~29.1 rupiah per share, assuming an exchange rate of 16,160. The cum date and dividend payment schedule have not yet been announced. Referring to MEDC share price on Thursday (30/5) at 1,410 rupiah per share, the indicated final dividend yield is 2.1%. Previously, MEDC also distributed an interim dividend of 25 million US dollars in December 2023.

tickerNews.title: Controller of Bumi Serpong Damai Purchased BSDE Shares
tickerNews.content: The controller of Bumi Serpong Damai, PT Paraga Artamida, purchased approximately 17.1 million BSDE shares at an average price of ~949 rupiah per share between May 21-28, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 16.3 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, PT Paraga Artamida's ownership in BSDE increased from 39.77% to 39.85%.

tickerNews.title: Kalbe Farma Expands Prescription Drug Business in Thailand Through Acquisition
tickerNews.content: Kalbe Farma, through its subsidiary Kalbe International Pte. Ltd., signed a cooperation agreement with Alliance Pharma Co. Ltd. to expand its prescription drug business in Thailand. In this cooperation, Kalbe International Pte. Ltd. will acquire a 49% stake in Alliance Pharma Co. Ltd. for an undisclosed amount.

tickerNews.title: Bloomberg Intelligence Analyst Predicts Thermal Coal Prices Will Stabilize in 2H24
tickerNews.content: Bloomberg Intelligence industry analyst, Kevin Ng, stated that domestic thermal coal prices in Indonesia are likely to stabilize in 2H24, after having fallen by -58% during 2023. Ng mentioned that high demand from India is likely to add price support, while higher price movements will depend on the Fed's interest rate cuts and new stimulus in China.

tickerNews.title: Mazda Indonesia Commits to Building Assembly Facility
tickerNews.content: The COO of Mazda Indonesia, Ricky Thio, stated that they are committed to building a car assembly facility worth 400 billion rupiah by absorbing Indonesian experts and labor.
